text: thanks to bbc weather watchers kay and robin red breast for their snaps of wootton bridge woodland on the isle of wight and slightly soggy-looking beach huts at studland in dorset .
send your of the region to us via our oxford , hampshire , dorset , and berkshire facebook pages , or on twitter at @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: armed forces to provide ceremonial support at royal wedding
text: prince harry and meghan markle 's wedding day will feature regiments and units that have a special relationship with the royal who served in the military for a decade , the ministry of defence has announced .
household cavalry troopers will line the staircase at st george 's chapel , windsor castle , where the couple will be married on may 19 .

streets within the precincts of the castle will be lined by members of the windsor castle guard from 1st battalion irish guards , and by armed forces personnel from the royal navy small ships and diving , royal marines , 3 regiment army air corps , the royal gurkha rifles and raf honington .
musical will be provided by the band of the irish guards .
trumpeters and a captain 's escort from the household cavalry will also provide ceremonial support bringing the total number of armed forces involved with the wedding to more than 250 .

documents.title: thatched hotel staff thank firefighters for 'saving ' building
text: staff at a thatched hotel and pub that was partially damaged in a roof fire have thanked firefighters for `` saving '' the building .
more than 120 firefighters tackled the blaze at the potters heron , in ampfield near romsey , hampshire , on 19 march .
no-one was hurt in the fire , which is believed to have started in the chimney .
on monday hotel director ted kennedy said it had since reopened and designs were being drawn up for the damaged section to be rebuilt .
a lovely message from @ twitterid thanking our crews for their work in the 25-engine # thatch blaze in # ampfield # romsey # ampfieldfire # teamhants # 999family @ twitterid

documents.title: 'mad panic ' after oscar left on train
text: 'mad panic ' after oscar left on train

documents.title: mutilated cat found in hampshire garden
text: the mutilated body of a cat had been found in a garden in hampshire .
police said the animal was discovered in the thicket ( in portchester , fareham .
whiteley village vet centre , where the cat was taken , has reported the incident to snarl animal rescue and cats protection .
snarl said it was investigating and would look at possible links to the infamous serial cat killer .
the find is the second in a week in the area , a spokeswoman added .

documents.title: traveller encampment leaves car park
text: travellers have left a public car pack where they have camped for more than two weeks .
their departure comes after oxford city council served a court order on tuesday instructing them to leave .
the caravans arrived at redbridge park and ride on 10 march and at one point about 36 were on the site .
oxford city council said rubbish left by the travellers was now being cleared and it expected the car park to be back to normal shortly .

documents.title: berkshire firefighter retires after 30 years
text: today we are saying farewell to station manager eddie cardoso , who is retiring after 30 years of dedicated service in various roles across # berkshire .
best of luck for the future , eddie # rbfrs # tvfcs
good luck eddie best wishes for the future
thank you eddie for the work you 've done for all of us in the thames valley - enjoy the future !
respect ed !
all the best eddie .

documents.title: 'youngest councillor ' dies aged 21
text: 'youngest councillor ' dies aged 21

documents.title: school 's boarding house plans approved
text: plans to build a new boarding house at ryde school on the isle of wight have been approved by council planners .
the proposals will go before the secretary of state , following an objection from sport england .
revised plans , with changes to the design of the boarding house , were submitted to isle of wight council in december after the authority refused the original proposals .

documents.title: teenagers in meningitis b vaccine trial
text: teenagers are being asked to take part in an oxford-based study to learn if immunising them against meningitis b could protect them and other people .
the nhs wants 24,000 to take part in the oxford vaccine group 's be on the team trial , which is helped by national institute for health research funding .
bacteria at the back of the throat can cause meningitis and the study will see if vaccination can stop this happening .
the trial will take place in four waves of recruitment over the next two year

documents.title: boy , 15 , in court over school stabbing
text: boy , 15 , in court over school stabbing

documents.title: linkin park 's mike shinoda to play reading after bandmate 's death
text: linkin park 's mike shinoda has announced his first uk shows since the death of bandmate chester bennington .
the rapper and keyboardist will play at the reading and leeds festivals this summer .
chester , linkin park 's lead singer , took his own life in july 2017 following a struggle with depression and addiction .
shinoda has described the grief he felt following his friend 's death and how it fed into his latest ep post traumatic .
author: BBC Newsbeat

documents.title: new twickenham deal for varsity rugby
text: a new agreement has been struck to keep the varsity match between oxford and cambridge universities at twickenham stadium .
the deal with the rugby football union ( rfu ) means the game will stay at the home of england rugby until 2021 .
the men 's varsity match has been played at the stadium since 1921 and the women 's match since 2005 .
stephen brown , rfu chief executive , said : we 're delighted to welcome back oxford and cambridge universities to twickenham for the men 's and women 's varsity matches .
`` this is one of rugby 's oldest fixtures and we look forward to hosting this great contest for four more years . ''

documents.title: clarissa slade : university 'saddened ' at councillor death
text: a university in hampshire says it is `` saddened '' by the death of a student from devon who was also britain 's youngest councillor .
the body of 21-year-old clarissa slade was found in a property in winchester , where she was studying .
ms slade became britain 's youngest councillor when she was elected to mid devon district council authority in 2015 , aged 18 .
the university of winchester said : `` we are deeply saddened by her death and our thoughts and prayers are with her family and friends at this difficult time . ''
hampshire police said officers were called to an address in thurmond crescent in the town on monday afternoon after the body of a 21-year-old woman was found .
`` the death is currently being treated as unexplained , '' the force said .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: two teenagers killed as car hits trees
text: two teenagers killed as car hits trees

documents.title: triple crash referred to police watchdog
text: triple crash referred to police watchdog

documents.title: two teenage women die in basingstoke crash
text: two 18-year-old women have died after the car they were travelling in came off the road and hit trees .

the car , a white fiat 500 , was found on the side of the a30 eastbound in basingstoke , close to the hatch pub , at 05:00 bst , but it is not yet known exactly when the crash happened , police said .
the driver of the vehicle and her passenger , one from basingstoke and the other from hook , were pronounced dead at the scene .
their next of kin have been informed .

documents.title: we like big boats and we can not lie
text: `` it 's not what we usually do `` say road policing officers as they prepare to escort a rather big boat across parts of east anglia .
this one 's going from oundle in northamptonshire , along the a605 south to the a1 at st neots in cambridgeshire , then through cambridge city centre before heading for the suffolk coast .
it 's the `` most convenient route avoiding high bridges and tight bends '' , officers from the bedfordshire , cambridgeshire and hertfordshire road police unit say .
the officers accompanying the boat are volunteering for the task on their days off , and the cost of the trip is not funded by the `` public purse '' , they 're keen to point out .
they probably just like big boats

and if that 's the case , it 's their last chance to escort one this size as the manufacturer - fairline yachts - is moving part of its business to a new facility in hythe , southampton water , where its larger vessels will be built in the future .
a slightly different job for the road policing unit today , ensuring the safe escort of this yacht through the county on its journey to suffolk .
what 's the route will try to avoid nothing personal mind
a605 to a1 , south to st neots , across to cambridge and through the city centre .
the most convenient route avoiding high bridges and tight bends .
have fun .
do n't go through a drive thru .
i ca n't help but feel this is not the best use of resources
the officers are working their rest day , the funding does not come from the public purse .
no arguments here then !
nice boat !
last 78 foot yacht built by @ twitterid leaves # oundle .
larger models will in future be built at new site in # southampton more @ twitterid @ twitterid
after watching look east i really would n't want to follow that ship by road .
awesome as it is .
yes our cameraman actually got stuck on his way to the next job !

documents.title: inmate threw faeces in prison officer 's face
text: an inmate who threw faeces at a prison officer , some of which went in her mouth and also temporarily blinded her , has received a further jail term .
mohammed omar , 21 , pleaded guilty to administering a poison or noxious thing with intent to injure , aggrieve or annoy and criminal damage while at hmp yoi portland , dorset .
he is currently serving an eight-year prison sentence for an offence of wounding with intent to cause grievous bodily harm and possession of a bladed article in a public place .
his new 14-month sentence will be served consecutively .

documents.title: hundreds of maidenhead residents without power
text: more than 400 homes and businesses in the centre of maidenhead are without power .
southern electricity said the power cut affecting properties around the high street happened just before 10:30 bst .
engineers are dealing with the fault and power is expected to be back on at about 13:30 .

documents.title: man who died in tree crash 'taken too young '
text: a 27-year-old motorist who died when the car he was driving crashed into a tree was `` taken too young '' , his family has said .
christopher tarrant , known as `` tosh '' , from basingstoke , died at the scene on the a33 basingstoke road in kingsworthy at 02:00 bst on monday .
in a tribute , his family said : `` his motto was 'yolo ' - you only live once .
he will be sorely missed by everyone .
gone but not forgotten . ''
a 27-year-old woman , who was the front seat passenger , was also pronounced dead at the scene .
a 21-year-old woman , who was travelling in the back of the car , was seriously injured and taken to hospital .

documents.title: oldest ex-thames valley police officer set for 103rd birthday
text: great to see our oldest @ twitterid pensioner reg rumbles , who will be 103 in a few weeks time .
picture shows him in 1950s guarding the race day cup .
an amazing man - still interested in policing .
if he joined at 18 , pensioner at 48 .
that 's almost 55 years of pension .
what a legend !
lovely that you are still in contact .
great tell him we said hi
amazing thank you sir for your service
what 's brilliant about this is you make the time to remain in contact .
very well done sir
that 's amazing !
what he must have seen over his 103 years & how policing has changed !
a nice story and i dare say a very interesting gent .
what a delightful tweet .
amazing
it is great you took time out to visit him too
the real meaning of the policing family
interest in life keeps you alive - once you lose interest in life your life is nearing its end - good to see active support of pensioners
fantastic sir me x paramedicgrahamsings let 's save our nhs me x
what a truly excellent thing to see the chief constable marking this former officer 's life at 103 years old with a personal visit to him .
you can see the pride on mr rumbles 's face - a very happy birthday to him too
top bloke !
reg you are fantastic !
i 'll bet reg has some very interesting stories to share .
i hope he has lots of visitors to keep him alert .
well done reg .
fantastic age is but a number and great to see people still care in this day and age well done
an amazing tweet - well done reg !
great that we still visit : - )

documents.title: clarissa slade : parents 'devastated ' by daughter 's death
text: the parents of a mid devon councillor who has died suddenly at the age of 21 in winchester say they are `` obviously devastated by the loss of our beautiful daughter '' .
twenty-one-year-old clarissa slade became britain 's youngest councillor when she was elected to the mid devon authority in 2015 .
she was attending university in the hampshire city and her body was reportedly found by her housemate on monday .
her father , colin slade , said she `` showed an interest in politics as a young teenager , got involved in campaigning and was elected our youngest councillor in 2015 aged just 18 '' .
she had so much more to give so it is tragic her life has been cut so short .
she said her long-term ambition was to be prime minister - who knows what she could have achieved .
she will be greatly missed by all who knew her . ''
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

roads improving in dorset despite post-beast pothole problem ( say the rac )

documents.title: council pays tribute to youngest member clarissa slade
text: a devon council has paid tribute to its youngest member after her `` sudden and tragic '' death in winchester .
twenty-one-year-old clarissa slade became britain 's youngest councillor when she was elected to the mid devon authority in 2015 at the age of 18 .
she was attending university in the hampshire town and her body was reportedly found by her housemate on monday .

on the authority 's facebook page , council chief executive stephen walford said her death was `` clearly a great shock to everyone at the council and will affect all those who worked with clarissa and the community she served . ''
clarissa 's parents , who are both serving councillors here at mid devon , will be devastated by this news and we will be supporting them in any way we can . ''
council leader clive eginton said the `` devastating news has been deeply felt by myself , fellow councillors and officers across the council '' .
clarissa had an endearing personality to all those who knew her well , and we will miss her enormously .
our thoughts at this time are with clarissa 's parents , colin and elizabeth . ''
a book of condolence had been opened at phoenix house , the council said .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police apology over child sex case court order breach
text: police apologise after breaching judge 's court order on major child sex exploitation case

documents.title: airfield objections derail housing plan
text: a plan allocating sites for more than 22,000 homes in south oxfordshire has been blocked due to concerns about developing an airfield .

a majority of south oxfordshire district council 's members voted against the local plan despite the council 's leader supporting it , with many unhappy at the inclusion of 3,000 homes on chalgrove airfield .
local plans are documents setting out the future development for particular areas and once in place are used as the starting point for considering whether planning applications can be approved .
councillor john cotton said the decision would delay the local plan for about a year which was a `` disaster '' .
author: Bethan Phillips
Political reporter, BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: portsmouth nightclub blaze sees 1,000 led to safety
text: about 1,000 clubbers had to be led to safety after a fire broke out at a portsmouth nightclub .
the fire started in the ceiling above the dancefloor at the astoria , guildhall walk , at about 01:40 gmt during its mid-week dirty disco event .
police and door staff helped clubbers out of the three-storey building while fire crews put out the blaze and dealt with extensive smoke logging .
the club said it would open at midday for people to collect their belongings .
no-one was hurt in the fire .

documents.title: berkshire schools in meningitis b vaccine trail
text: two berkshire schools are taking part in a trial of the menigitis b vaccine .
for the first time jabs will be given to teenagers across the country not just babies .
thatcham 's kennet school and queen anne 's in caversham are taking part .
head teacher of kennet gemma piper says it 's important young people are given the opportunity to take action against the deadly disease .

documents.title: yeovil motorist due in court over weymouth grandfather death
text: a driver accused of killing a grandfather in a car crash is due to appear in court later .
mervyn thomas , 72 , from weymouth , was a passenger in a peugeot 2008 when it was in collision with a bmw on portland beach road , dorset , on 28 june last year .
he died in hospital the next day .
two other men sustained serious injuries .
antony williams , 50 , from yeovil , has been summonsed to appear before weymouth magistrates ' court today .

documents.title: travel latest : a34 southbound delays at a303 junction
text: # a34 southbound - rtc at the jct with the # a303 at bullington .
1 lane blocked and very slow from litchfield , 25min delay .
a303 from basingstoke very slow approaching a34 junction .
10-15 min delay
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: john fisher : tributes to volvo ocean race yachtsman 'lost at sea '
text: tributes have been paid to the yachtsman who fell overboard during a round-the-world race in the southern ocean .
john fisher , 47 , from southampton , known as `` fish '' fell from team sun hung kai 's scallywag yacht 1,400 nautical miles west of cape horn at 13:42 gmt on monday .
organisers said on tuesday he is now presumed to be lost at sea .
skipper of team brunel , bouwe bekking , who is currently leading the fleet towards cape horn , said : `` we are deeply shocked .
our thoughts are with his family and of course the scallywag crew .
`` there has n't been a moment since we heard that i did n't wake up thinking about him ``
the six boats still racing in leg 7 are now 900 miles from cape horn .
the scallywag crew is expected to reach chile on friday .

documents.title: boy charged after stabbing at school
text: a teenage boy has been charged after a girl was stabbed at a school .
the victim , a pupil whose age has not been confirmed , was attacked at testwood school in totton , hampshire , shortly after 11:00 bst on monday .
she suffered a non-life-threatening puncture wound to the abdomen , hampshire constabulary said .
a 15-year-old from totton has been charged with wounding with intent and possession of a knife blade/sharp pointed article in a public place .

documents.title: philip askew rape trial : ex-ice dancer found not guilty
text: a former champion ice dancer has been found not guilty of raping a girl aged under 16 .
philip askew , 44 , denied assaulting the girl in his room at the ymca in slough in 1995 when he was 21 years old .
at the time , mr askew was a star skater and coached young people at bracknell ice rink .
as the verdict was read out yesterday , family members screamed and sobbed with apparent relief in the public gallery at reading crown court .

documents.title: southampton pedestrian hurt by 'fail to stop ' car
text: a pedestrian was seriously injured after being hit by a car that had failed to stop for the police yesterday .
the volvo hit the victim and a brick wall in bevois hill , southampton , just after 14:00 bst on tuesday .
it reportedly caught fire before rolling over and also colliding with a bmw , hampshire constabulary said in a statement .
a man was arrested at the scene .

documents.title: fire breaks out on nightclub dancefloor
text: clubbers in portsmouth were led to safety in the early hours after a fire broke out on the dancefloor of a nightclub .
firefighters were called to astoria on guildhall walk at 01:40 gmt after the blaze broke out in ducting .
the fire service said no-one was injured .
crews from @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid & @ twitterid have been dealing with a serious fire at astoria nightclub , guildhall walk , portsmouth .
everyone safely evacuated .
great hard work by all crews including @ twitterid and the door staff !
good work guys .
